delete.warning: You are about to delete this Backend, are you sure?

dashboard.title: Open vStorage Backends
dashboard.helpcontent: This panel displays the state of all Open vStorage Backends managed by this cluster. It shows how many ASDs are in use by the backend, grouped by their state.

presets.name: Name
presets.cantdelete: The preset is in use or is default
presets.policyinfo: Policies displayed in bold will be used when writing new data

policies.title: Policies
policies.helpcontent:
Each available policy (e.g. (5, 4, 8, 3)) consists out of 4 numbers:
  • k: The amount of data fragments (e.g. 5)
  • m: The amount of parity fragments (e.g. 4)
  • c: The minimum numbers of fragments to write (e.g. 8)
  • x: The maximum number of fragments per storage node (e.g. 3)
For example, (5, 4, 8, 3) means each object will be split in 9 fragments (5 data and 4 parity) which will be stored across all available disks. The object can be written as soon as 8 fragments can be written. However, no more than 3 fragments will end up within a single storage node. In case this policy can not be met, the policy will be unavailable. If no policies are available, the backend can not be used.
policies.shorthelpcontent:
Parameter information:
  • k: The amount of data fragments (e.g. 5)
  • m: The amount of parity fragments (e.g. 4)
  • c: The minimum numbers of fragments to write (e.g. 8)
  • x: The maximum number of fragments per storage node (e.g. 3)
  • Requirements: k <= c <= (k + m)

gather.asdipshelp: Select the ips on which the ASDs should listen. Select nothing for to listen on all ips.
gather.basicinfo: Enter the required information to add the ASD node. This information can be found on the node in the file /opt/alba-asdmanager/config/config.json

gather.name: Name
gather.invalidname: Invalid name (should be between 3 and 20 letters and/or numbers)
gather.insufficientpolicies: There should be at least one policy
gather.invalidk: One or more 'k' values do not meet the requirement k <= c <= (k + m)
gather.invalidc: One or more 'c' values do not meet the requirement k <= c <= (k + m)
gather.invalidx: One or more 'x' values do not meet the requirement k <= c <= (k + m)
gather.warning:
Adding presets can help shape the Open vStorage Backend to your specific needs.

When creating a preset, make sure to understand the impact of certain compression algorithms and policies. For example, creating a (1, 0, 1, 1) policy might cause dataloss when a single disk fails. Remember that the order in which policies are defined is the same order in which policies will be used. Make sure to put the safest/most preferred policies on top.

Improperly configured presets can cause dataloss!

confirm.basicinfo: Confirm your preset. Make sure policies are in the correct order and are correctly defined.
confirm.inprogress: Creation of the preset is in progress

confirm.basicinfo: Confirm your preset. Make sure policies are in the correct order and are correctly defined.
